Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: Spanish L3 gave me such an amazing opportunity to improve my reading, writing, and speaking skills in the language of spanish.  I especially learned a great amount of grammar in this course.
I improved in Spanish overall. It was a great course.
I improved my vocabulary, grammar, and comfort level in understanding, speaking, and writing Spanish.
I learned more about grammar and verb conjugations. In addition, I became much more comfortable with listening comprehension and my writing skills improved.

By taking this course, I have better learned how to communicate my ideas in Spanish as well as comprehend the ideas that my professor and classmates communicate to me in Spanish. My Spanish vocabulary has been enriched with new words and phrases; consequently, my writing skills have also improved.
I developed my Spanish listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills by taking this course.
Fluency greatly improved.
Great class
My speaking, writing, and listening skills improved greatly. I also learned more spanish and more ways to communicate in spanish.

This class goes extremely fast and the professors take a while to get used to with their accents and how fast they speak.  Although I came in understanding a fair amount of spanish, it was definitely a large leap forward with how fast I had to catch on.
Overall good class can't really complain. Maybe we could have done a little more presentations because those were definitely the most challenging.

I think a particular strength is that the entire course was talk in Spanish at all times. I thought that the curriculum was particularly fast in the middle of the semester and wonder if there is a way to even that out a bit.

This course was very successful in its intent of being an immersion environment for students. As a result, it really helped with listening comprehension. Additionally, the course was very successful with going over the grammar learned in previous years of study without spending too much time on the information so that students could feel confident in their base. I found the course to be well organized and cannot think of any major improvements that are needed.

The strengths of this course were the incorporation of short films and daily homework that serves as constant practice of the language. However, I feel as though there should have been more time dedicated to speaking among me and my peers so I could strengthen my casual conversation skills even more.
I think this course does a great job progressing ones Spanish skills.

Strengths: Building fluency

Weaknesses: Definitely can cut down on the workload. A lot of "busy work."

Strength: complete Spanish immersion. 
Weakness: lack of diversity and creativity in the curriculum
Improved proficiency in speaking and writing

This is a great course talk really well. It is challenging but also really interesting. Everyone was really engaged in class. This class was so good that I don't have any real ideas on how to make it better except to maybe grade a little more leniently.

I would definitely recommend this course to someone who enjoys speaking spanish.  It teaches you proper grammar and gives you the opportunity to learn much more about the spanish culture and language.
Yes it is a great class and even better when you have Seor Diaz
I would recommend this course. It's so important to learn languages these days, and Spanish in particular is so important in the United States! I thought this class was taught well.
I would recommend this course. It improved my reading, writing, speaking, and comprehension abilities in Spanish.
yes
Yes, it helps your fluency and skill level in Spanish and it isn't too fast to keep up with

I would definitely recommend this course to another student (especially if they want to improve their listening skills!) However, one must always dedicate some time to the assignments for the course because while they are not super intellectually challenging, they do require some time on the part of the student.
Yes if they wish to improve their Spanish skills.
Yes, if you would like to become fluent.
Yes, really helped improve my Spanish.
Yes, especially if you take it with a great professor like Daz.
